item.title: The User Object
item.description:
The User object

Field Type Required Description
id string Yes Unique identifier for the user.
name string Yes Full name of the user.
email string Yes Email address of the user.
created_at string No Timestamp when the user was created (ISO 8601).
updated_at string No Timestamp when the user was last updated.
status string No User status (e.g., active, inactive).

Example

{
  "id": "12345",
  "name": "Jane Doe",
  "email": "jane.doe@example.com",
  "created_at": "2025-06-01T12:00:00Z",
  "updated_at": "2025-06-07T08:30:00Z",
  "status": "active"
}

item.title: Create a User
item.description:
üÜï Create a User

POST /v1/users

Use this endpoint to create a new user in the system.

üî∏ Request Headers

Header Value Required Description
Authorization Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN ‚úÖ Your API access token
Content-Type application/json ‚úÖ Request body content type

üì• Request Body Parameters

Send a JSON object with the following fields:

Field Type Required Description
name string ‚úÖ Full name of the user
email string ‚úÖ Email address of the user
password string ‚úÖ Password for the new user

‚úÖ Example cURL Request

curl -X POST https://api.example.com/v1/users \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "name": "John Smith",
    "email": "john.smith@example.com",
    "password": "securePassword123"
  }'

item.title: Recruitment Agent Explained
item.description:
impact.com‚Äôs Recruitment Agent automates partner application processing by analyzing your partnership data, pre-approving partners who align with your brand, and allowing them to start promoting you instantly‚Äîremoving the need to apply processing rules manually.

Note

Interested in getting the Recruitment Agent? Reach out to your CSM to learn more.

Benefits of the Recruitment Agent

  • Partner with top-tier talent: Partners identified by the Recruitment Agent are exclusively vetted, productive, and of consistently high quality.
  • Review click-active partners: You can easily view partners who are ready to promote your brand and remove them if you feel they aren‚Äôt a good fit.
  • Modify your recruitment criteria: You can easily modify or disable the recruitment rules.

Recruitment Agent best practices

  • View your newly added click-active partners ‚Äî Engage with new partners as they join your program to facilitate their successful next steps.
  • Modify your workflow conditions ‚Äî To cast a wider net or make any changes to the recruitment criteria, you can adjust your workflow conditions.

View your auto-approved partners

  1. From the left navigation, select [Engage] ‚Üí Partners ‚Üí Applications.
  2. Select the Processed tab.
  3. Select Processed By filter ‚Üí Workflows.
    • If you want to remove a partner, you can expire their contract.

Modify your workflow conditions

  1. From the left navigation menu, select [Engage] ‚Üí Partners ‚Üí Automation ‚Üí Workflows.
  2. Hover over the Workflow you want to modify, then select Edit.
  3. Navigate to the Conditions section to add or remove approval conditions.
    • Select [Add] And to add a condition that must also be true for the action to take place.
    • Select [Add] Or to add an alternative condition that, if true, is sufficient for the action to take place.
    • Select [Delete] next to the approval condition to remove an approval rule.

item.title: Mobile App Reports Overview
item.description:
You can view your available balance, what you’ve earned today, and any pending amounts payable to your account, as well as a quick snapshot of your key performance metrics.

  1. From the navigation bar at the bottom of your screen, select [Reports].
  2. View your current balance and current and pending earnings.
    Earnings and balance reference
    Field Description
    Available Balance This field gives you a live representation of funds available for withdrawal. The progress bar below the Available Balance shows how much you must still earn before an auto-withdrawal will take place.
    Today’s Earnings This field displays the amount of commission you’ve earned today.
    Pending Amount The total value of all funds still due to you and the amount payable to you on the next payment date. The value shown is not finalized until the action locking period passes.
  3. View a snapshot of your key performance metrics.
    • This section is a graphical representation of your key performance metrics. Use the [Drop-down menu] to select a timeframe and select 1 of the options provided to view the data for that metric.
      Earnings and balance reference
      Metric Description
      Clicks The total number of times users followed your ad links to brand landing pages.
      Sale Amount The total value of revenue you generated for all brands within the selected timeframe.
      Actions The total number of conversions you drove, excluding any reversed by brands.
      Action Earnings The total number of individual payments you earned for driving conversions.
      CR The conversion rate is calculated as the number of Actions divided by the number of Clicks, and it represents the percentage of clicks that result in conversions.
      EPC The average amount of commission earned per click driven.

item.title: A diagram of the documentation lifecycle
item.description:
The diagram below illustrates the end-to-end documentation workflow, from drafting the initial content to publishing it live on your help center.

graph TD A["Start: First Draft"] --> B["Review by Technical Writer"] B --> C["SME Review"] C --> D["Revisions / Edits"] D --> E{"Approved?"} E -- "Yes" --> F["Apply Style Guide"] E -- "No" --> B F --> G["Final Review"] G --> H{"Ready to Publish?"} H -- "Yes" --> I["Push to Version Control"] I --> J["Static Site Generation with Hugo"] J --> K["Publish to Production Site"] K --> L["End: Live Documentation"]

item.title: EmotiCalc‚Ñ¢
item.description:
How to Use EmotiCalc‚Ñ¢ Without Getting into an Argument

Warning

You're about to read a joke!

Overview

EmotiCalc‚Ñ¢ is not your average calculator. In fact, it‚Äôs not even your average sentient calculator. Designed to help you ‚Äúfeel‚Äù your way through math, EmotiCalc‚Ñ¢ responds to emotional cues, passive-aggressive tone, and mid-life crises. This document will guide you through the basic operations, survival strategies, and conflict de-escalation techniques necessary to use EmotiCalc‚Ñ¢ successfully.
